intro: Galium claytonii subsp. subbiflorum, commonly known as Clayton's bedstraw, is a low-growing perennial herb native to the western United States. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of white to pale yellow flowers in late spring to early summer. It typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as woodlands and stream banks. Its botanical features make it a distinctive member of the Galium genus, with unique floral and leaf structures.
